The '''Lucid Air''' is a [[Battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] 4-door luxury [[Sedan (automobile)|sedan]] made by [[Lucid Motors]]. Announced in December 2016 and sold starting in 2021, it is designed to compete with the [[Tesla Model S]], the [[Karma Revero]], the [[Porsche Taycan]], as well as other luxury electric vehicles made by [[Mercedes-Benz]], [[BMW]] and [[Audi]].<ref name=electrek20161214 /><ref name=tc20170316>{{Cite web|url=http://social.techcrunch.com/2017/03/16/how-does-the-lucid-air-stack-up-against-the-competition/|title=How does the Lucid Air stack up against the competition?| website= [[TechCrunch]] |language=en-US|access-date=2019-05-06}}</ref>

The Dream Edition's [[United States Department of Energy|EPA]] range is estimated at {{cvt|520|mi}}.<ref name=EPA2022FEG /> The production model was unveiled in September 2020, and production began in late 2021.<ref name=lucid20200911 /><ref name=":0">{{Cite web|last=Baldwin|first=Roberto|date=February 26, 2021|title=Lucid Air Electric Sedan Will Miss Spring Delivery Timetable |url= https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35636414/lucid-air-production-delay/|access-date=2021-07-13|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US}}</ref>

In November 2020, the Lucid Air Pure was announced with {{cvt|406|mi}} of projected range and {{Convert|480|hp}} and a starting price of US$77,400.<ref name="to start">{{Cite web|last=Baldwin|first=Roberto|date=2020-11-25|title=2022 Lucid Air Pure, Base Model of the New EV, to Start at $77,400|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a34777320/2022-lucid-air-pure-priced/|access-date=2021-07-13|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US}}</ref> The range of trim levels includes Pure, Touring, Grand Touring, and Dream Edition.<ref name="to start" />

On September 28, 2021, Lucid Motors announced that production had begun, with the base Pure model expected in late 2022.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Lucid to start deliveries of electric cars with range exceeding Tesla's in October|website=[[Reuters]].com |date=29 September 2021| url= https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/lucid-start-deliveries-electric-cars-with-range-exceeding-teslas-october-2021-09-28/|last1=Jin|first1=Hyunjoo}}</ref> Deliveries commenced on October 30, 2021, with the first reservation holders taking delivery of Air Dream Editions in an event in [[California]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/lucid-air-dream-editions-first-143629420.html|title=Lucid Air Dream Edition's First Customers Can Take Possession Of Luxury EV Sedan Saturday |website= finance.yahoo.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Dreams Come True: Lucid Air Customer Deliveries Officially Begin |url= https://insideevs.com/news/544452/lucid-air-customer-deliveries-begins/|access-date=2021-11-20|website=InsideEVs|language=en}}</ref>

__TOC__

== History ==
The Lucid Air was conceived in the early 2010s, with a [[concept car|prototype]] unveiled to the public in 2016,<ref name=electrek20161214>{{Cite web|last=Lambert|first=Fred|date=2016-12-14|title=Lucid unveils its electric sedan called 'Air': 400 miles of range, 1000 hp, 'autonomous-ready' and 'more than $100,000'|url=https://electrek.co/2016/12/14/lucid-air-electric-sedan-range-price/|access-date=2020-09-05|website=Electrek|language=en-US}}</ref> and the production version unveiled in September 2020, with production planned for 2021.<ref name=lucid20200911>{{Cite web |last=|first= |date=September 9, 2020 |title=Dream Ahead |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zgbde-SgWGM|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=September 9, 2020|website=[[YouTube]]}}</ref><ref name=":0" />

Lucid contracted with [[Samsung SDI]] on December 2, 2016, to supply batteries.<ref name=lucid20190519>{{Cite web |url=https://lucidmotors.com/stories/lucid-and-samsung-sdi-strategic-partnership |title=Lucid and Samsung SDI Strategic Partnership |date= 2016-12-06| website=LucidMotors.com | publisher= Lucid Motors |language=en|access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref><ref name=insideev20161213>{{Cite news |url= https://insideevs.com/news/330641/lucid-motors-teams-with-samsung-sdi-to-develop-next-gen-lithium-ion-battery-cells/ |title=Lucid Motors Teams With Samsung SDI To Develop Next-Gen Lithium-Ion Battery Cells |last=Lucid |work= [[Motorsport Network#InsideEVs|InsideEVs]] |date=13 December 2016 |access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref>

In 2016, Lucid Motors created a delivery van with the prototype of its electric powertrain for the Air using batteries from its former brand, Atieva. Known as "Edna", the delivery van contained two gearboxes, motors producing over {{Convert|900|hp|0|abbr=on}} and an 87 kWh battery pack. Combined with [[all-wheel drive]] and other physical and software updates, Edna was able to achieve 0–{{Convert|60|mph|abbr=on}} in 2.74 seconds and a quarter mile in 11.3 seconds.<ref>{{Cite web |url= https://lucidmotors.com/stories/edna-gets-upgrade|title=Edna Gets an Upgrade|date=2016-10-11 |website= LucidMotors.com | publisher= Lucid Motors |language=en|access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref> According to Lucid Motors, Edna was used to test the real world performance of its powertrain, including "motor control algorithms, regenerative braking behaviors, accelerator pedal feel, and cooling strategies".<ref>{{Cite web |url= https://lucidmotors.com/stories/introducing-edna|title=Introducing Edna|date=2016-07-13 |website= LucidMotors.com | publisher= Lucid Motors |language=en|access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref>
[[File:LagunaSecaMay08.jpg|thumb|In 2018 Lucid Motors set a new record for EVs at Laguna Seca with the Air, achieving a time of 1:39.30]]

In 2018, a modified Lucid Air prototype set an EV lap record of 1:41.67 at the [[Laguna Seca]] track, beating the Jaguar I Pace by seven seconds, previously holding a previous record of 1:48.18.<ref name=electrek20180906>{{cite news |url=https://electrek.co/2018/09/06/lucid-air-laguna-seca-beats-jaguar-tesla/|title=Lucid Air prototype beats production Jaguar/Tesla EVs by ~7 seconds in Laguna Seca lap |last=Dow|first=Jameson |date=2018-09-06 |work=Electrek |access-date=2019-05-28 }}</ref> The prototype Air was equipped with "Pirelli P Zero PZ4 summer tires, modified high temperature brake pads and fluid, a 6-point roll cage and fire suppression system"''.''<ref name=lucid20180909>{{Cite web |url=https://lucidmotors.com/stories/lucid-air-sets-laguna-seca-lap-time-14167|title=Lucid Air Sets Laguna Seca Lap Time of 1:41.67 |date=2018-09-09 |website=LucidMotors.com | publisher= Lucid Motors |access-date=2019-05-28 }}</ref>

In 2018, Lucid Motors closed a {{USD|1 billion}} investment deal with [[Government of Saudi Arabia|Saudi Arabia]]'s [[Public Investment Fund]] to fund the Air production,<ref name=verge20180917 /> then expected to commence in late 2020 following the construction of the Lucid factory in [[Casa Grande, Arizona]].<ref name=verge20180917>{{Cite web |url= https://www.theverge.com/2018/9/17/17869450/lucid-motors-saudi-arabia-deal-tesla|title=Lucid Motors closes $1 billion deal with Saudi Arabia to fund electric car production|last=Hawkins|first=Andrew J.|date=2018-09-17|website=The Verge|access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref> The factory investment was expected to reach {{USD|675 million}} by 2025 when all phases are complete, with the first phase including a {{USD|168 million}} investment in equipment and {{USD|82 million}} to acquire property.<ref name= azcentral20190219>{{Cite news |url=https://www.azcentral.com/story/money/business/tech/2019/02/18/lucid-motors-break-ground-soon-casa-grande-car-factory-arizona/2859345002/ |title=Casa Grande preparing for Lucid's high-dollar Arizona car factory |work=AZ Central |date=19 February 2019 |access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref>

By May 2019, the Air was available for pre-order in the United States and Canada, with plans slated for China.<ref name= carsr20190527>{{Cite web|url=https://www.carshowroom.com.au/news/lucid-air-on-sale-now-for-68-000/ |title=Lucid Air On Sale Now For $68,000 |website= carshowroom.com.au|access-date=2019-05-27}}</ref> In an interview, CEO Peter Rawlinson stated that China was projected as a significant market for Lucid Motors due to their intensive usage patterns, for which the Air is best suited.<ref name="chargedev20190519">{{Cite web |date=24 April 2018 |title=A look at Lucid Motors: Q&A with CTO Peter Rawlinson |url=https://chargedevs.com/features/a-look-at-lucid-motors-qa-with-cto-peter-rawlinson/ |access-date=2019-05-10 |website=chargedevs.com}}</ref>

In a 2019 interview, Rawlinson outlined that the US$100,000-plus vehicle could be the first stage of a much bigger vision, which could achieve a level of [[Efficient energy use|energy efficiency]] that combined with a ubiquitous fast charging network, would counteract the need for larger batteries.<ref name=insidedev20190525>{{Cite web|url=https://insideevs.com/news/342642/exclusive-lucid-explains-long-term-vision-for-affordable-luxury-ev/|title=Exclusive: Lucid Explains Long-Term Vision For Affordable Luxury EV| website=insideEvs.com|language=en|access-date=2019-05-25}}</ref> Rawlinson said that Lucid Motors aims to improve energy efficiency to {{cvt|5|mi|0}} / kWh compared to an industry average of {{cvt|3|mi|0|abbr=}} / kWh.<ref name=insidedev20190525 /> Rawlinson further predicted that the price of batteries was expected to drop to US$100 / kWh within the next decade, which he believes will enable Lucid Motors to produce a luxury EV for less than US$30,000.<ref name=insidedev20190525 />

On June 30, 2020, Lucid Motors said that they expected the Lucid Air to be "the world's most aerodynamically efficient luxury car when it goes into production".<ref name="gcr20200708" /> The company "achieved a new benchmark in aerodynamic efficiency for its luxury electric car...with tests recently completed at [[WindShear|Windshear]]'s advanced rolling-road wind tunnel, the automaker verified a coefficient of drag of 0.21."<ref name=gcr20200708>{{Cite web|title=Lucid Air claimed to be the most aerodynamically efficient luxury car| url= https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1128703_lucid-air-claimed-to-be-the-most-aerodynamically-efficient-luxury-car|access-date=2020-07-08 |website= Green Car Reports|language=en}}</ref>

On May 5, 2022, Lucid Motors announced that it was raising prices of its luxury Air sedan beginning June 1. The price hikes would push the base price of the Air sedan up as much as 13%.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Lucid is raising prices on its luxury Air EV |url=https://social.techcrunch.com/2022/05/05/lucid-is-raising-prices-on-its-luxury-air-ev-by-as-much-as-13/ |access-date=2022-05-06 |website=TechCrunch |language=en-US}}</ref>

== Overview ==
[[File:2023 Lucid Air Touring, rear 7.23.23.jpg|thumb|Rear view]]
[[File:Lucid Air fresh off the lot (driver's seat).jpg|thumb|Interior]]

=== Design ===
The Air has been designed to compete in the luxury sports segment against the Tesla Model S as well as high-line models from German car manufacturers.<ref name=tc20170316 /> Its goal is to match the ability of sport [[coupés|coupes]],<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |url= https://lucidmotors.com/|title=Lucid| website= LucidMotors.com | publisher= Lucid Motors |language=en|access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref> but has a greater interior space, with a smaller external length and width.<ref>{{Citation| publisher= Lucid Motors| title=Exploring Air: Space Reimagined| date=2017-04-14 |via= YouTube |url= https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zKWTjlBksqM|access-date=2019-05-06}}</ref> The exterior design was led by Derek Jenkins.

On September 9, 2020, the Lucid Air was officially unveiled, and on November 24, 2020, Lucid Motors detailed the full range including the Lucid Air Pure, Touring, Grand Touring and Dream Edition.<ref name="to start" />

=== Range ===
The Dream Edition R's [[United States Department of Energy|EPA]] range is up to {{cvt|520|mi}},<ref name=EPA2022FEG /> making it the longest range of any [[electric vehicle|EV]] rated by the EPA.<ref name=Doll>{{cite news|url=https://electrek.co/2021/09/16/lucid-shares-epa-range-for-air-models-including-520-miles-on-the-dream-edition-range/|author=Scooter Doll|date=September 16, 2021|title=Lucid shares EPA range for Air models including 520 miles on the Dream Edition Range|work=Electrek}}</ref>

On November 24, 2020, the company-predicted range for all four models was announced: {{cvt|406|mi}} for the Lucid Air Pure and Lucid Air Touring, {{cvt|503|mi|abbr=on}} for the Lucid Air Dream Edition, and {{cvt|516|mi}} for the Lucid Air Grand Touring.<ref name=Doll /><ref>{{Cite web |title= Lucid Names Its Base Model Lucid Air Pure|url=https://insideevs.com/news/456415/lucid-air-pure-base-model/|access-date=2020-12-25 |website= InsideEVs.com |language=en}}</ref> A 2022 test drive revealed that the Grand Touring model only managed 410 miles; however, this was still the first EV tested by ''[[Car and Driver]]'' to top 400 miles.<ref name=Dorian>{{cite news|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/a40628362/2022-lucid-air-grand-touring-by-the-numbers/|author=Drew Dorian|date=July 18, 2022|title=Tested: 2022 Lucid Air Grand Touring Dazzles with Clever Design and Inspired Engineering|work=Car and Driver}}</ref>

=== DreamDrive (ADAS) ===
On July 29, 2020, Lucid Motors announced DreamDrive, an [[Advanced driver-assistance systems|Advanced Driver-Assistance System]] (ADAS) which will debut in the Air. The DreamDrive sensor suite has 32 sensors in total, including "14 cameras: Three forward-facing, four side- and rear-facing, four surround-view, a rear-facing, a rear-facing fisheye, and lastly, a driving monitoring one. There are five radar units. One is a forward-facing long-range sensor, and the other four are short-range ones. Twelve short-range ultrasonic sensors handle near-field detection, and lastly, a high-resolution, long-range, 125-beam (equivalent), forward-facing Lidar maps the three-dimensional space ahead of the car."<ref name=motortrend20200729>{{Cite web|date=2020-07-29|title=2021 Lucid Air's DreamDrive Driver Assistance Package Will Include 32(!) Sensors|url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/2021-lucid-air-dreamdrive-driver-assistance-package-details/|access-date= 2020-08-12|website= [[Motor Trend]] |language=en}}</ref>{{clarify|how is Lucid controlling the ADAS? are they using any machine learning or AI like some competitors?|date=September 2020}}

=== Aerodynamics ===
The preproduction Air has a {{Cd|0.21|long=yes|link=car}}.<ref name=gcr20200708 /> Later reporting from ''[[Motor Trend]]'' gives it as {{Cd|0.20}} for the production version.<ref name= MTCOY /> Rawlinson claims the Air has less drag than the [[Mercedes-Benz EQS]] due to a smaller frontal area.<ref>{{cite web| url= https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0001811210/000110465921093160/tm2122473d1_425.htm|title=Lucid Investor Call Transcript |date= July 16, 2021 |publisher=Securities and Exchange Commission|website= SEC.gov |access-date= September 16, 2021}}</ref>

=== Powertrain ===
{{Main|Electric vehicle motor}}
[[File:Lucid Air Chassis - center and rear.jpg|thumb|Lucid Air chassis at Lucid Studio in New York City]]
Lucid Motors uses [[lithium-ion battery]] cells sourced from [[LG Chem]] to supply the Air's primary powertrain.<ref name=lucid20190519 />

The entry level Air Pure will be equipped with a 88-kWh battery with rear wheel drive, capable of producing {{cvt|480|hp|0}},<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lucidmotors.com/air/specs|title = Lucid Air | Specs |website=LucidMotors.com | publisher= Lucid Motors |date= | access-date= }}</ref> {{cvt|600|Nm|0}} of torque and {{cvt|406|mi|0}} of range.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Lucid Air: 235mph EV to be launched at New York motor show|url=https://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/motor-shows-new-york-motor-show/lucid-air-235mph-ev-be-launched-new-york-motor-show|access-date=2020-08-19|website=Autocar|language=en}}</ref> The Air Dream Edition Range will have a 112-kWh battery pack which will provide an estimated {{cvt|520|mi}} of EPA range. The Air Dream Edition Performance will have a combined output of {{Convert|1,111|hp|0|abbr=on}} and will be able to accelerate from {{cvt|0|–|60|mph}} in 2.5 seconds.<ref name=":1" /> In their most recent performance test, it achieved a top speed of {{cvt|235|mph}}.<ref>{{Cite web| url= https://electrek.co/2017/07/10/lucid-motors-all-electric-sedan-top-speed/|title=Lucid Motors hits 235 mph (378 km/h) top speed with its all-electric sedan| last= Lambert |first= Fred |date= 2017-07-10|website=Electrek|language=en-US|access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref>

{{as of|2021}}, the most efficient version on sale in the US, the Air Grand Touring with 19-in wheels, has an EPA rated energy efficiency of {{cvt|26|kWh/100mi|mpge}}.<ref name=EPA2022FEG />

Later independent reporting on real-world testing (drag strip performance times) showed the {{cvt|1,111|hp|kW|0}} Air Dream variant achieving a {{convert|1/4|mile|m|0|abbr=out}} time of 10 seconds flat. The test providers noted that conditions on that particular day were suboptimal (colder than ideal temperature for example), leading them to speculate that {{frac|1|4}} mile times closer to 9.8 seconds could be achieved under friendlier conditions.{{Citation needed |date= March 2022}}

=== Battery / Charging ===
[[File:Lucid Air Electric Drive Unit and Battery.jpg|thumb|Lucid Air Electric Drive Unit and Battery]]
Lucid Motors plans to offer a nationwide charging plan to customers in the US through its joint agreement with [[Electrify America]].<ref name=thedrive20190510>{{Cite web |url=https://www.thedrive.com/tech/23813/lucid-motors-to-use-electrify-america-charging-network-for-its-air-electric-car |title=Lucid Motors to Use Electrify America Charging Network |last=Edelstein|first=Stephen |website=The Drive |access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref> The 800-volt DC charging system, first used by the [[Porsche Taycan]], allows variable voltages up to 1000 volts, and thus is fully compatible with Lucid's 924-volt electrical architecture.<ref name=electrek20200205>{{cite web |last1=Lambert |first1= Fred |title=Lucid: Tesla hasn't cracked it, we can take it to whole new level of range and efficiency |url= https://ww.electrek.co/2020/02/05/lucid-air-tesla-range-efficiency/ |website=[[Electrek]] |date=5 February 2020}}</ref>

When used with a 300 kW or higher charging station, the vehicle can gain 300 miles of range in 20 minutes.<ref>{{Cite web |last= Brady |first= Duncan |date= 2021-08-25|title=2022 Lucid Air|url=https://www.motortrend.com/cars/lucid/air/2022/|access-date=2021-09-13| website= Motor Trend| language=en-US}}</ref>  The vehicle features a bidirectional rectifier capable of supplying up to 19.2 kW (240V ~ 80A) of AC power that could power a home or other load.<ref name="lucid20200911" />

It upconverts 400-volt or lower power coming from a charger to its operating voltage. It downconverts the battery pack's 900 volts to 400 volts to power other loads in the vehicle or to charge another vehicle.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Markus |first=Frank |date=2021-11-15 |title=The 2022 Lucid Air's Stunning EV Powertrain Tech Is Why It's So Far Beyond the Competition |url=https://www.motortrend.com/features/2022-lucid-air-powertrain-tech-deep-dive/ |access-date=2023-01-07 |website=MotorTrend |language=en}}</ref>

The company claims that its 2170 cells differ significantly from normal lithium ion cells due to their tolerance of repeated cyclic fast charging and non-use for a prolonged period of time while maintaining capacity.<ref name="chargedev20190519" />

== Features ==
[[File:Lucid Air Dream edition, IAA Open Space 2023, Munich (P1120054).jpg|thumb|upright|Front trunk]]
Other standard features include: "LED headlights, all the necessary hardware for autonomous driving, four high resolution screens (three of which are touch sensitive), 19-inch alloy wheels, 10-speaker sound system, 12-way power adjustment for the front seats with heating, front and rear trunk with a total luggage space of around {{Convert|900|liters|cuft|abbr=}}, and over-the-air software updates."<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.caradvice.com.au/532921/lucid-air-will-significantly-undercut-tesla-model-s-on-price/|title=Lucid Air will significantly undercut Tesla Model S on price |website=CarAdvice.com|language=en|access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=http://social.techcrunch.com/2017/03/16/the-lucid-air-electric-car-starts-at-just-60000-before-tax-credit/|title=The Lucid Air electric car starts at just $60,000 — before tax credit|website= TechCrunch|language=en-US|access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url= https://www.theverge.com/2017/3/16/14944068/lucid-motors-air-electric-car-price-range-specs|title=Lucid Motors' electric car will cost $60,000|last=O'Kane|first=Sean|date=2017-03-16|website=The Verge|access-date=2019-05-10}}</ref>

The Air can be optioned as a dual-motor, all-wheel-drive powertrain producing up to {{convert|1,111|hp}} for the top of the range Air Dream Edition P.

Other options include: "active suspension, a panoramic sunroof, executive rear seats that can recline up to 55 degrees, a 29-speaker sound system with noise cancellation, 20 or 21-inch alloy wheels, and 22-way electric adjustment front seats with ventilation, dynamic bolsters and massage."<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" />

== Reception ==
The Lucid Air was chosen as one of the Top 10 Tech Cars by the [[Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers|IEEE]] in 2018<ref>{{cite journal|date=April 2018 |journal=IEEE Spectrum |title=Top 10 Tech Cars: 2018 | issn=0018-9235 |volume=55 |issue=4 |page= 30 |doi= 10.1109/MSPEC.2018.8322044 |s2cid=4116523 }}</ref> and is the 2022 [[Motor Trend Car of the Year]].<ref name=MTCOY>{{cite web |title=The Lucid Air is the 2022 Car of the Year |url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/lucid-air-2022-car-of-the-year/ |website=Motor Trend |date=15 November 2021 |access-date=25 Dec 2021}}</ref> Also in 2022, Lucid Air achieved the record for Longest Range and Fastest Charging Speed of any vehicle ever tested by [[Car and Driver]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-07-18 |title=Lucid Air Grand Touring Has Best Range of Any EV We've Tested to Date |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a40633791/lucid-air-grand-touring-best-ev-range-tested/ |access-date=2023-04-11 |website=Car and Driver |language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-03-24 |title=2022 Lucid Air Dream Charges More Quickly Than Any Other EV |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a39502213/2022-lucid-air-dream-performance-charging-test/ |access-date=2023-04-11 |website=Car and Driver |language=en-us}}</ref> In April 2023 the Lucid Air was named the 2023 World Luxury Car of the Year by the [[World Car Awards]].<ref>{{Cite web |publisher=Lucid Group |title=Lucid Air Wins 2023 World Luxury Car of the Year |url=https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/lucid-air-wins-2023-world-luxury-car-of-the-year-301791054.html |date=2023-04-05 |access-date=2023-04-07 |via=PR Newswire}}</ref>
